intro: Peyritschia tolucensis, commonly known as the Tolucan peyritschia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique species from threats such as deforestation and climate change.
